    • Method Detail

      • query

        public SearchTimeline.Builder query(String query)
        Sets the query for the SearchTimeline.
        Parameters:
        query - A UTF-8, URL-encoded search query of 500 characters maximum, including operators. Queries may additionally be limited by complexity.

      • geocode

        public SearchTimeline.Builder geocode(Geocode geocode)
        Sets the geocode for the SearchTimeline.
        Parameters:
        geocode - Restricts query to a given geolocation

      • resultType

        public SearchTimeline.Builder resultType(SearchTimeline.ResultType resultType)
        The result_type parameter allows one to choose if the result set will be represented by recent or popular Tweets, or a mix of both.
        Parameters:
        resultType - possible options include recent, popular, mixed, or filtered.

      • languageCode

        public SearchTimeline.Builder languageCode(String languageCode)
        Sets the languageCode for the SearchTimeline.
        Parameters:
        languageCode - Restricts tweets to the given language, given by an ISO 639-1 code. Language detection is best-effort.

      • maxItemsPerRequest

        public SearchTimeline.Builder maxItemsPerRequest(Integer maxItemsPerRequest)
        Sets the number of Tweets returned per request for the SearchTimeline.
        Parameters:
        maxItemsPerRequest - The number of tweets to return per request, up to a maximum of 100.

      • untilDate

        public SearchTimeline.Builder untilDate(Date date)
        Returns tweets generated before the given date. Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Keep in mind that the search index may not go back as far as the date you specify here.
        Parameters:
        date - Date before which the tweets were created.

      • build

        public SearchTimeline build()
        Builds a SearchTimeline from the Builder parameters.
        Returns:
        a SearchTimeline.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if query is not set (is null).
